subtitle: A warming recipe that's ideal for a mid-week dish. Jerk seasoning comes from Jamaica - traditionally made from a blend of spices like allspice, chilli, pepper, bay leaves and paprika.

method.text: Heat half the oil in a large non-stick frying pan. Add apple slices and cook for 4 min or until golden brown. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
Add chicken to pan and cook for 4 min, stirring occasionally until golden brown. Add onion, garlic, ginger and stir- fry for 2 min or until soft.
Add jerk seasoning, lime rind and juice, soy, apples and tomatoes.
Season well. Bring to boil and simmer for 10-15 min or until tender.
